definition: name/noun (part of speech)/place (e.g. among winners)/famous/classifier for people
down/downwards/below/lower/later/next (week etc)/second (of two parts)/to decline/to go down/to arrive at (a decision, conclusion etc)/measure word to show the frequency of an action

sentences.english: Is this house, which is called by my name, become a den of robbers in your eyes?
sentences.chinese: 这称为我名下的殿在你们眼中岂可看为贼窝吗？

sentences.english: But they set their abominations in the house, which is called by my name, to defile it.
sentences.chinese: 竟把可憎之物设立在称为我名下的殿中，污秽了这殿。

sentences.english: We will transfer your bills to your new room.
sentences.chinese: 我们将账转到您的新房间名下。

sentences.english: Then all the peoples on earth will see that you are called by the name of the LORD, and they will fear you.
sentences.chinese: 天下万民见你归在耶和华的名下，就要惧怕你。

sentences.english: Taking credit for other people's work is a form of lying and stealing.
sentences.chinese: 把别人的功劳归到自己名下是撒谎和偷盗的一种形式。

sentences.english: Policies taken out in his name prove that he was fully insured.
sentences.chinese: 以他名下购买的各种保险单证明他是全保了的。

sentences.english: "We run women's requests under men's names, " says Tayyab.
sentences.chinese: “我们会把妇女的要求放在男人名下”，塔亚布表示。

sentences.english: Braderson wouldn't have a thousand acres to his name.
sentences.chinese: 勃洛得生名下连一千英亩地也不会有啦。

sentences.english: He was baptized in the year 1981.
sentences.chinese: 于是在1981年受洗归入主名下。

sentences.english: Why is Sue down as belonging to the first group?
sentences.chinese: 为什么把苏记到第一组的名下？

sentences.english: Hundreds of billons are being given to banks and insurance companies.
sentences.chinese: 数千亿美元转到了银行和保险公司名下。

sentences.english: House property is the name, hen in baifeng resolution find baifeng help.
sentences.chinese: 房子的产权是在白凤名下，世贤决议找白凤帮助。

sentences.english: Fetch me those Brown files right now.
sentences.chinese: 马上帮我查一下布朗名下的档案袋。

sentences.english: For example, one power-up allows you to automatically collect rent from your buildings.
sentences.chinese: 比如，有一种道具可以自动收集你名下物产中的租金。

sentences.english: At just 24 years old, Garg has two ventures to her name.
sentences.chinese: 年仅24岁的加尔格名下已经有了两家公司。

sentences.english: Most is for what the government has ordered, which raises the next question.
sentences.chinese: 大部分则分到了政府名下，而这就带来了下一个问题。

definition: to provide (an asset) as security for a loan/to put up collateral
to transfer ownership (of a vehicle, securities etc)/(real estate) conveyancing
to sequester/to seize (assets)/to seal up/to close down
population (counted as number of households for census or taxation)/registered residence/residence permit/(in Hong Kong and Macau) bank account
variant of 贈予|赠予[zeng4 yu3]
to repay a debt in kind or by labor
to fund/to put money into sth/to invest
